title: Northern Irish business leaders fear collateral damage from a 'kamikaze' Brexit deal
text:
Northern Irish business leaders fear they will become “collateral damage” if Boris Johnson’s Government strikes a “kamikaze” Brexit deal without consulting them.

The province’s most prominent industry groups say they have been kept in the dark while it attempts to agree a Brexit deal with Brussels.

They fear that in the scramble to conclude a deal with the European Union, the Government and parliament risk locking the UK into legally-binding arrangements that are unworkable for Northern Irish businesses.

“There is a risk of being tipped over into an outcome that is totally unworkable but we’re just collateral damage,” Declan Billington of the NI Food and Drink Association, told The Telegraph...
description: Northern Irish business leaders fear they will become “collateral damage” if Boris Johnson’s Government strikes a “kamikaze” Brexit deal without consulting them.
